adviseScripts.text: Come on, Coach, say it with me!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Put your hands together!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Go! Go! Victory!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: You can do it!
You can't do it!
Everyone, clap your hands!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I knew you'd remember that, Coach!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: That's fantastic!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Coach... is that supposed to be some kind of joke?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Er... Yeah, I'm just kidding.
I shout cheers and chants with Clay.
When people get cheered on, some get nervous,
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: while others feel reassured.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Which one are you, Coach?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I get nervous.
I feel reassured.
R-really?!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I'll have to be careful if I ever need to cheer for you then...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Hehe, really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Whenever you need a boost,
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: just give me a shout!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I have a conversation about cheerleading.
Whenever I catch myself missing the beat,
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I start to wonder if I'm just getting in Bay's way.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: What do you do when you start doubting yourself?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I work hard to overcome it.
I focus more on what I know I can do well.
I... I see.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: In that case, I'll try harder to stay on beat!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I can help too.
You're right!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Bay is good at cheerleading, and you've got incredible showmanship.
Hehe, thanks, Coach!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I don't feel so anxious anymore!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I have a conversation about overcoming our weaknesses.
Ever since I joined Rewind, I feel like I've been living in a dream!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Have you felt that way before, Coach?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Yeah, all the time.
Let me see... Not really.
That's because I get to work with awesome people like you.
Coach...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: As expected, Coach, you are a good person...!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Oh, really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I hope your dreams will come true soon...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Me too. I'll keep at it.
I'll definitely be cheering for you all the way!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I talk more about our dreams.
When I arrive at the Commander's Room, I find Clay hesitantly looking at her phone.
What are you up to, Clay?
Oh, hey, Coach!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: We actually didn't do too well in a recent competition, so now I'm kinda scared to check the internet or the news...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: But at the same time, I feel that feedback could be helpful, so I should take a look... right?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Turn off all your devices and enjoy some me time.
We've got to accept all the feedback we're given, both good and bad.
You know better than anyone else what areas need improvement.
You... You're right!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: From now on, I've gotta make time to reflect upon myself!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Yeah... But there are so many negative comments.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: No pain, no gain I guess...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I talk more about how to come to terms with public opinion.
I stayed up late practicing last night and ended up oversleeping.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Do you have any good idea I can use to get up on time?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: What about sleeping in the practice room?
Set multiple alarms every 5 minutes.
That's a great idea!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: There's even a shower in the practice room!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: If I stay there, I definitely won't have to worry about oversleeping.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Still, the best solution is not to put yourself in situations where you end up pulling all-nighters.
I know... I'll try not to stay up too late from now on!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: That's what I've been doing,
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: but whenever I'm super tired, I just can't hear the alarm.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: There must be a better way...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I think of ways to prevent her from oversleeping.
Urgh...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Bay seems to have a lot on her mind...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Like what?
It must have to do with Rewind's reputation not being what it used to...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Reputation isn't everything.
That's okay. You both can build it back up again.
D-do you really think so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: But getting more popular means more offers come in, too...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Otherwise, how can we continue?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Hehe, I guess you're right about that!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: As long as I've got Bay, we'll be able to rehabilitate Rewind's reputation, no problem!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I talk more about Rewind's reputation.
I just performed at a small festival held at a senior center,
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: but the audience response was a bit... lukewarm.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Do you think I did anything wrong?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Older folks may find it difficult to respond enthusiastically.
Perhaps it's because the audience was smaller?
Oh, I see!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: That makes me feel a lot better, hehe!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I dunno... every seat in the place was occupied...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Do you think it's because they didn't like my routine?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I continue to analyze the audience's reaction.
*Sniffle*
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay is crying in the Commander's Room.
What's wrong, Clay?
I kept missing the beat today and messed up our whole routine.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Just keep practicing so you won't make mistakes in the future.
Everyone makes mistakes.
I'm up late every night practicing, but I don't feel like I'm getting any better.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: It's so frustrating!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: How about recording yourself so that you can get a better idea of what mistakes you're making?
The important thing is how you handle it afterward.
Y-you're right!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I should get a better idea of what mistakes I'm making.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Thanks, Coach!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I talk about what she should do to avoid making mistakes.
Clay is staring at me intently.
Whenever I'm with you, I feel like I've got someone in my corner!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Maybe you've got an innate talent for cheerleading, Coach.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I do like encouraging others.
I'd feel a bit awkward doing cheerleading myself.
I'm not surprised to hear you say that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: You may not be a cheerleader,
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: but there's something about you that motivates me!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Oh... I see.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Still, just you being around is enough to give me strength,
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: so you ought to have a bit more confidence in yourself!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I talk more about me and my ability to motivate her.
Hey, Coach!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I practiced all day yesterday for the competition.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Wanna take a look?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Sure, show me.
I'd rather watch the final performance at the stadium myself.
Hehe, okay! I can give you a sneak peek right here!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay moves to ready herself, then looks around the room.
Hmm... If I do it here, the furniture might get damaged!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Can we move to the practice room?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Sure, let's go.
Oh, okay... then you have to be sure to come on that day!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I'll be there.
I promise Clay that I'll go watch her new and improved routine.
Coach, do you consider yourself a good dancer?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Come to think of it, I've never seen you dance!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I think I'm pretty decent.
I've got two left feet.
Whoa, really? Could you show me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I do a dance that I saw on TV recently.
What do you think?
Wow, you really are a great dancer!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Hehe, don't worry, Coach!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Let me teach you something I learned from Bay recently!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Okay, thanks.
I do a simple dance in front of Clay.
Someone I work with asked me
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: why I end so many of my sentences with exclamation marks!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Do you think I use them too often, Coach?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I think you're okay!!! Totally!!!
Everyone has their own way of speaking.
... Are you making fun of me right now?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: No, no! I was just being silly.
I didn't realize you have a silly side to you...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: That's what I said to them!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I knew you would understand!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: So you see, there's no need for you to feel down.
Hehe, thanks, Coach!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I have a conversation about the way she speaks.
No matter how hard I try,
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I can't seem to stay on beat...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: How can I train my sense of rhythm?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Try clapping to the beat of the song I'll play.
How about playing a rhythm game?
Y-you want me to do it right now?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I start playing a song.
*Clap clap clap*... *Clap* Ah!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Let's try it again.
Okay! I won't give up!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I've tried that a few times already,
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: but I kept messing up and the game wouldn't let me continue...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I work together with Clay to hone her sense of rhythm.
Coach!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Who do you think
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: would be a good new member for Rewind?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Someone cool and composed.
Someone passionate and energetic.
Hmm...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I dunno, I think someone with some energy might be better!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Wow, that sounds great!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I feel like I'd get a big energy boost just from being around someone like that!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I'm sure we'd have a great time cheerleading together!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I discuss what a potential new member of Rewind would look like.
Whenever I'm out cheering at all these different sports events,
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: it breaks my heart whenever I see how torn up the losing teams are.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Do you think there's anything I could do for them?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: It might be best to give them some space and let them compose themselves.
How about rooting for the losing team?
Hm... I don't know...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: If I were them, I feel like I'd want someone cheering me on.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: 'Cause, you know, once the game's over, no one ever notices the losing side...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Wow, that's a great idea!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I'll cheer them on with all my might and help them get back on their feet!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I exchange ideas on rooting for the loosing side.
There's a competition coming up in a few days where I'll be participating as a representative of Rewind.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: It's all been so last minute that I haven't had much time to practice.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Do you think I'll do okay without Bay?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Just do what you always do, and keep your head held high.
If you haven't put in the time, you can't expect a miracle.
I will!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I'll put my best foot forward!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Thanks for the encouragement, Coach. I already feel more at ease!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I-is that so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: If I thought I could win without practicing, it might be disrespectful to those who've put in the effort...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Guess I'll just have to give it my all with the time I've got left...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay continues to tell me her worries about the upcoming competition.
Coach, do you think hard work and tenacity can beat natural talent?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: It's something that often crosses my mind while I'm watching sports matches.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I don't think effort means much in the face of overwhelming talent.
If you try hard enough, nothing is impossible.
Yeah... I kind of suspected that was the case.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Still... I'll cheer them on just as hard as I always have!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I want them to know that their effort has meaning!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I knew it!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I really hope everyone gets amazing results from all their hard work!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: As for me, I'll cheer them on just as hard as I always have!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I have a conversation about the difference between effort and talent.
Coach, look at this!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I got a gift from a fan!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I want to repay them somehow, but I don't know how.
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: How about making and selling some merch?
How about writing them a letter?
But I really want to convey my gratitude to my fans...
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Surely, there's a better way of doing that?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Hey, that's a great idea!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I'd love to write one with loads of gratitude!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Can I sit here and start writing it now?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I discuss different ways to give back to her fans.
There's nothing better than working up a sweat while cheerleading!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Do you like breaking a sweat, Coach?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Yes, it's proof of how hard I'm working.
No, it makes me feel uncomfortable.
That's exactly how I feel!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: That's why I feel super proud of myself when I work up a good sweat!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: And nothing beats showering after sweating it out.
Hehe, I see you really know your stuff, Coach!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Oh... really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: I guess you're right... Sweat can feel so sticky and uncomfortable sometimes!
adviseScripts.speaker: Clay

adviseScripts.text: Clay and I talk more about sweating.
